txt.en: Few among the living ever heard him speak, but his visage was well-known, and feared. They called him the Grim Southron, and while Men quailed at his approach during the Second Age, during the Third the legend of his malice had only grown. In later days it was he that Lhaereth the Stained followed in secret to Dol Guldur, where she discovered Sauron and helped him recover, for a price. Did the Dark Lord deal out reward or punishment for his Nazgûl's lapse? But that was much later. During the Second Age, the Grim Southron was known only to be patient, loyal, and silent.

The Nine have been set loose upon Middle-earth to hunt down those who would oppose the will of Sauron. The heroes of Middle-earth must rally and drive these fell lieutenants of the Dark Lord back into the shadows.
You have taken part in the overthrow of the Grim Southron!

So returned the Nazgûl, and with their coming the Dark Lord’s power grew. Sauron unveiled his might through their dreadful voices, which cried words of wrath and terror. Even the boldest quailed and cowered as the Wraiths passed – or yet stood unmoving, their weapons falling from hands gone cold as they yielded to thoughts of darkness, fear, and death.
Defeat the Black Blade of Lebennin
Defeat the High Sorcerer of Harad
